results.title: Full ahead
results.creator_credit: Roger Mirams, Chris Stewart and Pacific Films
results.brief_description: Shows the fleet of the Australian National Line at work, shipping distant raw materials to centres of secondary industry. Forty-four ships call at fifty-three ports, some being specially fitted to carry a particular bulk cargo, such as semi-trailers on the ‘Bass Trader’. Cargo carried includes ironstone from Yampi Sound, softwoods from Stanley, and raw sugar from Townsville. Practical training of the crew is carried out on board under the captain’s supervision.

results.title: Musical forms: the fugue (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Dissects the Fugue in G minor and explains various components, analyzing a typical fugue. Sight and sound are co-ordinated by an animated score and sufficient repetition is built in to enable the components to be learned.

results.title: Early Melbourne mansions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Looks at three Melbourne mansions, Toorak House, Trewalla and Illawarra, including brief histories.

results.title: Fuel for thought
results.brief_description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.
results.description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.

results.title: Fuel crisis
results.brief_description: The end of the petrol shortages and the promise of North Sea oil have led many people to believe that the crisis is over. The film shatters that illusion. Forecasts sizeable and increasing energy shortages for the 1980’s which could have traumatic political and economic effects on society

results.title: The Frustrating fours and fascinating fives [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
A study of the behavior of four-and-five-year-old children at home and at nursery school. At four the vacillation between infantile helplessness and vigorous self-assertion is seen, and at five the development of independence and the beginning of cooperation. Parents observe that, unpredictable as their behavior may be, it’s fun to help in the development of the fours and fives.

results.title: Fruits, vegetables and co-operation
results.brief_description: Bill shows his fellow-farmers, by means of films, how other farmers are benefiting by marketing their crops co-operatively. Jake, an ultra-conservative, offers many objections to this method, but he is finally won over to the idea of starting a local co-operative society on a small scale. Such crops as celery, lettuce, apples and citrus fruits are grown and marketed co-operatively with great success.

results.title: Fruit fly
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Mediterranean fruit fly is a serious pest of the fruit industry in Western Australia. It infests so many different types of fruit that it keeps alive throughout the seasons. It is the larvae that do the damage. It is necessary to keep orchards absolutely clean. One dirty orchard can affect the whole district.

results.title: Frontiers in space
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Exploring the universe with telescopes. Explains how astronomers use optical and radio telescopes to gather information about the universe. Shows the world’s largest reflecting telescope at Palomar Observatory in operation.
